alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 12:24AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON COUNTY... At 1224 AM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Mount Pleasant Regional Airport, or near Mount Pleasant, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Mount Pleasant, Isle Of Palms, Awendaw, Boone Hall Plantation, Garris Landing, Mount Pleasant Regional Airport, Price Inlet, and Bull Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
